newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Airconditioning blamed for smoke on PIA flight.
newsitem.headline: Airconditioning blamed for smoke on PIA flight.

text.p: Pakistan International Airline (PIA) said on Tuesday that smoke from a faulty airconditioning system had forced one of its aircraft to return to Almaty, Kazakhstan.
"The airconditioning system of the aircraft had malfunctioned, causing smoke in the cabin," a PIA spokesman said in a statement.
PIA's flight PK-296, which took off from Almaty for Karachi via Islamabad on Monday, returned to the Kazakh capital and landed safely.
The smoke was detected when the plane, a Tupolev-154, was flying at 2,500 metres (7,750 feet).
None of the 52 passengers or 13 crew were injured.
"Before landing, all safety procedures were carried out by the airport authorities although the 52 passengers on board were evacuated through normal steps," the spokesman said.
